snippet: After many attempts at using a real wolf, an animal skittish by nature, North Carolina State has settled on a dog that resembles one as its mascot.
abstract: Campus Corner column; Tuffy the wolf is the official live mascot of North Carolina State's football team, but he is not a wolf and his name is not Tuffy; mascot is a Tamaskan, mix of German shepherd, Alaskan malamute and Siberian husky first bred in Finland, and his real name is Wave; other college football news and scores noted.
lead_paragraph: After many attempts at using a real wolf, an animal skittish by nature, North Carolina State has settled on a dog that resembles one as its mascot.

headline.print_headline: Sheepdog in Wolf’s Clothing? Actually, Mascot Is Crossbreed
headline.seo: North Carolina State, Seeking a Wolf Mascot, Settles for Tuffy the Dog
headline.main: Sheepdog in Wolf’s Clothing? Actually, Mascot Is Crossbreed
